baseline_groups.claim_summary: Advisors who prefer to see the incentive first are more likely to recommend the incentivized product when assigned their preferred information order.
baseline_groups.notes: baseline uses assigned-preferences subsample (N=4448, coef=0.195); baseline_combined pools all (N=5908, coef=0.181). baseline_not_assigned is diagnostic.

baseline_groups.claim_summary: In the NoChoice experiment, seeing the incentive first increases recommending the incentivized product.
baseline_groups.notes: Separate experiment. nochoice/baseline_conflict N=213 coef=0.142; nochoice/baseline_combined N=299 coef=0.148.

baseline_groups.claim_summary: Demand for moral commitment predicted by costly treatment (seeincentivecostly negatively predicts choicebefore).

global_notes: Three claims. Duplicates: mturk_only=choicefree_only, placebo/noconflict=sample/noconflict. demand/with_selfishness changes treatment. not_assigned are diagnostics. getbefore is tautological.
